summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from October 2021 between defense attorney Joe Nascimento and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York. The emails primarily concern scheduling calls and meetings. A key revelation is that Nascimento's client, whose name is redacted, is comfortable sharing information about being victimized by Jeffrey Epstein with other victims and their counsel.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney at ROSS AMSEL RABEN NASCIMENTO, PLLC, corresponding with a federal prosecutor to schedule calls and discuss his client's willingness to share information about being victimized by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator who victimized the unnamed client of attorney Joe Nascimento.

connections.description: Nascimento's client is described as a victim of Epstein, making Nascimento the legal representative for an Epstein victim.

events.title: Attorney-Client Discussion on Sharing Victim Information
events.description: Attorney Joe Nascimento informs a prosecutor that his client is comfortable with him sharing information about how she was victimized by Epstein with other victims and their counsel.

events.title: Scheduled Video Meeting
events.description: A video meeting is scheduled between Joe Nascimento and a federal prosecutor for November 5, 2021, at 1 p.m.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (One Saint Andrew's Plaza, Southern District of New York)
Savannah (mentioned as location of Joe Nascimento's sentencing hearing)
keyFacts: An unnamed female client of attorney Joe Nascimento is identified as having been victimized by Jeffrey Epstein.
The client has authorized her attorney to share information about her victimization with other Epstein victims and their legal counsel.

The correspondence is between a defense attorney and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing legal proceedings or cooperation related to the Epstein case in late 2021.
The primary purpose of the emails is to schedule calls and a meeting, showing continued activity in the Epstein case years after his death.
